Skew and kurtosis

Source: R/skewKurt.R
skewKurt.Rd

Skew and kurtosis

Usage

skewKurt(x)

Arguments

x

Numeric vector

Value

A list of class "skewKurt" with:

VariableDescription
sSkewness with direction
s.seStandard error of skewness
s.zTest statistic (s.z = s / s.se)
s.pp-value (s != 0)
kExcess kurtosis with direction
k.seStandard error of excess kurtosis
k.zTest statistic (k.z = k / k.se)
k.pp-value (k != 0)

Examples

# Use skewKurt() on an anthropometric data from a SMART survey in
# Kabul, Afghanistan (dist.ex01)
svy <- dist.ex01
skewKurt(svy$muac)
#> 
#> 	Skewness and kurtosis
#> 
#> Skewness = +0.0525	SE = 0.0828	z = 0.6348	p = 0.5256
#> Kurtosis = -0.2412	SE = 0.1653	z = 1.4586	p = 0.1447
#>
